title: The Gospel of Barnabas
description:
Type: Early Christian writing (not in the Bible).

Date: Around 70–132 CE.

Not written by Barnabas (the companion of Paul), but attributed to him later.

Themes:

Interprets the Old Testament in a symbolic way.

Argues that the Jewish Law was misunderstood and fulfilled spiritually in Christ.

Stresses living a holy life and contrasts "the way of light" with "the way of darkness."

Status: Considered valuable by some early Christians, but not included in the New Testament canon. Found in the Codex Sinaiticus (a 4th-century Bible manuscript).

title: fasfd
description:
Chapters 1–39 → Warnings and judgment on Judah, Israel, and the nations.

Chapters 40–55 → Comfort, hope, and the "Servant Songs" (Messianic prophecies).

Chapters 56–66 → Future glory, new heavens and new earth, restoration of Zion.

title: Book of Izai
description:
God’s holiness and justice.

Warnings to Israel and Judah about sin and coming judgment.

Hope of redemption, restoration, and the coming Messiah.

Prophecies about the Suffering Servant and Messianic Kingdom.
